properties.areaDesc: San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire
properties.headline: High Wind Watch issued February 3 at 4:15AM PST until February 5 at 12:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Freeze Watch for tonight, sub-freezing
temperatures as low as 27 possible. For the Freeze Watch for
Tuesday night, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 25 possible.
For the High Wind Watch, north winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts to
60 mph possible.

* WHERE...San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland
Empire.

* WHEN...For the Freeze Watch from late this evening into Tuesday
morning and for late Tuesday evening into Wednesday morning.
For the High Wind Watch, from this evening through Tuesday
evening.

* IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power
lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be
difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Frost and
freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation
and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty north to northeast winds will develop
today, but will strengthen this evening and be strongest for
late tonight into Tuesday afternoon.
properties.instruction:
Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this
situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe
location prior to the onset of winds.

Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent
freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should
be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have
in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above-
ground pipes to protect them from freezing

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
